case_title: Novartis AG vs Nabiqasim Industries (Private) Limited
key_issues: Phonetic similarity between LESCOL and DESCOL
Prescription drug sales and public health concerns
Trade mark registration laws vs drug name registration

precedents_cited.case_name: Glaxo Laboratories Limited vs Assistant Registrar Trade Marks Karachi
precedents_cited.context: Public health concerns in pharmaceutical trademark disputes
Medication errors and likelihood of confusion

decision_summary.impugned_order_review: Learned Single Judge applied totality of impression test and considered packaging differences and prescription drug safeguards.
decision_summary.court_observation: Phonetic similarity and public health risks outweigh packaging differences. Deceptive similarity likely to mislead unwary purchasers.
decision_summary.final_decision: Impugned order set aside. Appeal allowed. CMA No. 8055/2007 granted. Main suit to be decided within six months.
